meanings.definition: To forcibly put an end to something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher suppressed the noise in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The government suppressed the rebellion swiftly.
meanings.sent3: The magician suppressed the rabbit in his hat, making it disappear.
meanings.sent4: Her smile suppressed the sadness in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The storm suppressed the flames, bringing relief to the firefighters.

meanings.definition: To keep something from being revealed or expressed.
meanings.sent1: She suppressed her laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent2: He suppressed his true feelings to avoid conflict.
meanings.sent3: The diary suppressed the secrets within its pages.
meanings.sent4: The mask suppressed her identity, hiding her true self.
meanings.sent5: The lock suppressed the contents of the mysterious box.

meanings.sent1: The medication suppressed the symptoms of the illness.
meanings.sent2: Fear suppressed her ability to speak up.
meanings.sent3: The fence suppressed the dog's urge to run away.
meanings.sent4: His determination suppressed any doubts in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The dam suppressed the flow of the river, creating a reservoir.
